meanings.definition: A shortened or condensed version of a written work.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked the students to read the abridgment of the novel for homework.
meanings.sent2: I prefer reading the abridgment of long books to save time.
meanings.sent3: The abridgment of the play made it easier to understand the storyline.
meanings.sent4: Her summary was like an abridgment of the entire book, capturing all the key points.
meanings.sent5: The abridgment of the article made the main ideas stand out clearly.

meanings.definition: The act of reducing or condensing something, such as a text or speech.
meanings.sent1: The abridgment of the speech made it more engaging for the audience.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate the abridgment of complex topics for easier understanding.
meanings.sent3: The abridgment of the recipe left out the most important ingredient!
meanings.sent4: His explanation was like an abridgment of the entire lecture, cutting out all the unnecessary details.
meanings.sent5: The abridgment of the document saved a lot of time during the meeting.
